Ethical Quandry: Spying on non-citizens (i.e. in other countries, folks living in America on green cards, etc.)
Bugging foreign officials' offices (i.e. the EU's), "monitoring" high-ranking officials' phones
Implementing surveillance programs that tap into major Internet company servers (i.e. those of Apple, Facebook, and Google)
Ordering a phone carrier to keep quiet about call metadata being tracked
Interpreting laws very differently (to an extent that parties may as well be talking about different laws)
